summary: the Coronaviridae family is classified into the Alpha-, Beta-, Gamma-, and Deltacoronavirus genera (-CoVs, -CoVs, -CoVs, and -CoVs, respectively) (2, 3). coVs have attracted widespread attention since the outbreaks of severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus (SARS-CoV) and Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV) nsp1 exists only in -CoVs and -CoVs. betacoronavirus nsp1 inhibition of host gene expression has been extensively studied. but study of the mechanism of TGEV nsp1 regulation of host translation is still in its infancy. length PEDV nsp1 (residues Met1 to Gly110) was obtained. the crystal structure was determined using the single-wavelength anomalous diffraction (SAD) method. each asymmetric unit contained two subunits, and the solvent content value was 36%, which might explain the good crystal diffraction. the secondary structure of PEDV nsp1 consists of two -helices (1 and 2) and six -strands (1 to 6) the six -strands form a -barrel fold flanked by -helices. the 2-helix is composed of six amino acids, making it longer than other reported coV nsp1 helices. glu14, Glu58, Lys70, and Arg107 exhibit conformation in the A chain that is different from that in the B chain. the positions of the side chains determine the size of the cavity opening toward the solvent. the cavity is also conserved in TGEV nsp1 (42). the amino acid sequence of PEDV nsp1 shared only 23% and 12% sequence identity with those of TGEV nsp1 and SARS-CoV nsp1 respectively. the sequence of PEDV nsp1 shared low homology with those of TGEV nsp1 and SARS-CoV nsp1 in this study. the sequences were aligned with ClustalW2, and the figure was prepared with ESPript3.0. despite lack of sequence homology, we sought to determine the level of similarity among the secondary structures of these nsp1 proteins. the loop between 3 and 4 is significantly shorter in the PEDV nsp1 structure. the loop between 3 and 4 is significantly shorter in the PEDV nsp1 structure. the loop between 3 and 4 is significantly shorter in the PEDV nsp1 structure. RMSDs between PEDV nsp1 and TGEV nsp11–104 or between PEDV nsp1 and SARS-CoV nsp113–128. nsp1 expression affects cellular gene expression. pcaggs-PEDV-nsp1-HA (PEDV nsp1), pcaggs-TGEV-nsp1-HA (TGEV nsp1), or pcaggs-SARS-CoV-nsp1-HA (SARS nsp1) expressed proteins had N-terminal HA tags. at 24 h posttransfection, cell lysates were prepared and subjected to Rluc assays HEK-293T cells were transfected with the pcaggs-PEDV-nsp1-HA (PEDV nsp1) plasmid. the cells were pulsed with 3 M puromycin for 1 h at 37°C. after 24 h posttransfection, the cells were pulsed with 3 M puromycin for 1 h. truncated plasmids nsp1(1–102), nsp1(1–95), nsp1(1–85), nsp1(1–71), nsp1(1–60), and nsp1(1–47) were tested. the results showed that residues 61 to 71, 72 to 85 and 103 to 110 might be involved in inhibiting luciferase reporter gene expression under the control region from aa 37 to 75 in PEDV nsp1 is crucial for NF-B suppression. region from aa 37 to 75 in PEDV nsp1 is crucial for NF-B suppression. PK-15 cells were transfected with the control (pcaggs) or nsp1 plasmid. at 24 h posttransfection, the cell were lysed and subjected to Rluc assays and Western blot analysis. the functional area of SARS-CoV nsp1 responsible for inhibiting protein synthesis is located at the C terminus (49) the functional area of PEDV nsp1 exhibited its own unique structure, comprising three loops. the different functional areas indicate that the mechanisms whereby PEDV and SARS-CoV nsp1 inhibit host gene expression are diverse. total intracellular proteins were extracted at 24 h posttransfection. the cells were lysed in Renilla luciferase lysis buffer. aliquots of the lysates were used to measure Rluc activities. ous diffraction (SAD) method was refined to a 1.25- resolution in the space group P1 21 1. N-terminal region to brown in the C-terminal region. the amino acid sequence of PEDV nsp1 shared only 23% and 12% sequence identity with those of TGEV nsp1 and SARS-CoV nsp1 respectively. the sequence of PEDV nsp1 was found to share low homology with those of TGEV nsp1 and SARS-CoV nsp1 in this study. the X-ray crystal structure of TGEV nsp1 (PDB accession number 3ZBD) and the nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) structure of the N-terminal domain of SARS-CoV nsp1 (PDB accession number 2HSX) were compared with the structure of PEDV nsp1. the structures of sARS-CoV nsp113–128 and PEDV nsp1 exhibit many differences. the lengths and angles of the 1-helix and the 2-helix are different. RMSDs were calculated using COOT. to determine whether nsp1 proteins suppress host gene expression, we examined Renilla luciferase (Rluc) using luciferase. pcaggs-PEDV-nsp1-HA (PEDV nsp1), pcaggs-TGEV-nsp1-HA (TGEV nsp1), or pcaggs-SARS-CoV-nsp1-HA (SARS nsp1) expressed proteins had N-terminal HA tags. at 24 h posttransfection, cell lysates were prepared and subjected to Rluc assays different doses of the wild-type plasmid (0 to 3.0 g) were transfected into HEK-293T cells. after 24 h posttransfection, the cells were pulsed with 3 M puromycin for 1 h at 37°C. the amino acid sequences of PEDV nsp1, SARS-CoV nsp1 and -CoV nsp1 were compared. plasmids nsp1(1–102), nsp1(1–95), nsp1(1–85), nsp1(1–71), nsp1(1–60) and nsp1(1–47) were tested. the results showed that residues 61 to 71, 72 to 85 and 103 to 110 might be involved in inhibiting luciferase reporter gene expression under the control of the simi the region from aa 37 to 75 in PEDV nsp1 is crucial for NF-B suppression. PK-15 cells were cotransfected with pRL-SV40 or pRL-TK. the truncations of PEDV nsp1 are shown below the bars. PK-15 cells were transfected with the control (pcaggs) or nsp1 plasmid. at 24 h posttransfection, the cell were lysed and subjected to Rluc assays and Western blot analysis. the functional area of PEDV nsp1 exhibited its own unique structure. the three loops in PEDV nsp1 differ from those in SARS-CoV nsp113–128 in terms of length and orientation. immune coprecipitation confirmed that the SARS-CoV nsp1 could interact with the 40S subunit (48) but that PEDV nsp1 could not. posttransfection and Western blot analysis performed using anti-HA and anti-GAPDH antibodies. at 24 h after transfection, cells were lysed in Renilla luciferase lysis buffer. aliquots of the lysates were used to measure Rluc activities. the structure is characterized by an irregular six-stranded -barrel fold in the middle of two -helices. the core structures of PEDV nsp1, TGEV nsp11–104, and SARS-CoV nsp113–128 were highly conserved. two loops (aa 67 to 71 and 78 to 85) in PEDV nsp1 supported by the protein's C terminus (aa 103 to 110) form a stable functional region; these are in significantly different conformations from their counterparts in SARS-CoV nsp1. structural difference implies that the mechanisms of -CoV nsp1 inhibition of host protein synthesis might be different. a recombinant MHV lacking the region encoding aa 277 to 309 of the nsp1 gene was severely attenuated in infected mice. the region from aa 160 to 173 of SARS-CoV nsp1 is critical for suppressing host innate immunity, providing insights into the development of attenuated vaccines. a 1 to 128) was cloned into the pCAGGS vector according to the same method. to determine the functional region of PEDV nsp1, point mutants and truncations were engineered according to the tertiary structure of PEDV nsp1. to avoid unexpected collapses of the structure that could potentially inactivate nsp1 were engineered. selenomethionine (Se-Met)-labeled PEDV nsp1 was expressed as previously described (58) for protein purification, the cells were harvested, resuspended in phosphate-buffered saline (PBS) and lysed via passage through an AH-1500 homogenizer. the target protein was eluted using a change gradient between the binding buffer (20 mM Tris [pH 7.4], 500 the crystals grew overnight and were then flash-cooled in liquid nitrogen in a cryoprotectant solution (0.1 M lithium sulfate monohydrate, 0.1 M sodium citrate tribasic dihydrate [pH 5.5], 20% [wt/vol] polyethylene glycol 1000, and 30% ethylene glycol) all of the diffraction images were integrated, merged, and scaled using HKL-3000 software (59). a pRL-TK plasmid was encoding the Rluc reporter gene downstream of the TK promoter. the nucleic acids were mixed gently; the DNA-Lipofectamine 2000 complex was fully formed after 20 min at room temperature. at 24 h posttransfection, cell lysates were prepared and subjected to Rluc reporter activity assays (Promega) cultures of HEK-293T and PK-15 cells were transfected with the wild-type PEDV nsp1 plasmid. cells were pulse-labeled with 3 M puromycin and then incubated for an additional hour at 37°C with 5% CO2. otic cells, wild-type nsp1, flanked with an HA tag, were cloned into the pCAGGS vector using ecoRI and XhoI restriction sites. a fragment (encoding aa 1 to 128) was cloned into the pCAGGS vector according to the same method. to determine the functional region of PEDV nsp1, point mutants and truncations were engineered according to the tert selenomethionine (Se-Met)-labeled PEDV nsp1 was expressed as previously described (58) for protein purification, the cells were harvested, resuspended in phosphate-buffered saline (PBS) after centrifugation at 8,500 rpm for 40 min, the supernatant was loaded onto a His Trap HP column. the best crystals of nsp1 were obtained through vapor diffusion in sitting drops consisting of 1 l of reservoir solution (0.1 M lithium sulfate monohydrate, 0.1 M sodium citrate tribasic dihydrate [pH 5.5], 20% [wt/vol] polyethylene glycol 1000, and 30% ethylene glycol) the crystals grew overnight and were then flash-cooled in liquid nitrogen in a cryoprotectant solution. PK-15 cells were cotransfected at 80% confluence with a pRL-TK plasmid encoding the Rluc reporter gene downstream of the TK promoter. pRL-TK plasmid encoding the Rluc reporter gene downstream of the TK promoter, along with corresponding protein plasmids. PCR was performed on an ABI Prism 7000 real-time thermocycler. the amount of target mRNA was normalized to an endogenous 18S rRNA. ribopuromycylation assay was performed as previously described.
